transcript.text: To know what’s considered confidential, think about the type of information about our business that we might want to protect. This is the same information that competitors will want to protect.

panelText.text: Confidential competitive information is any non-public, private information that has commercial value. This can include:

• Pricing strategy, price trends or marketing plans
  • Customers, turnover, or sales figures
  • Production costs or quantities
  • New product plans or internal technical information
  • Strategies for investments and technologies

Knowing these types of information about a competitor could give us a significant advantage. But when we are dealing with this type of information, we have to be very careful. As a general rule, if this information has not been disclosed in a public place, we can’t use it.
